item.title: Aros Cryo-EM Update
item.description:
Simon Sommerhage _October 30, 2025 (Thu), 18:38 Microscope: Krios G4 Total exposures: 9,688 movies Example micrograph
Green numbers indicate the estimated resolution (top), the class ID (bottom), and the particle count per class (in brackets).
Aβ42 Type 2 Fibril as determined by (Yang et al., 2022) (2D class averages marked in green)
Tau Paired Helical Filament (PHF) as determined previously by (Fitzpatrick et al., 2017) (marked in blue) "Eyelash" polymorph of unknown identity (marked in red)

Current resolution is limited to approximately 10 Å. Reconstruction optimization is ongoing to improve resolution. Characteristic backbone already visible
Exemplary 2D class averages of eyelash polymorph(s) Asymmetric polymorphs exhibit regions of varying width in micrographs and 2D class averages. The distinctive appearance resembles eyelashes, suggesting an oblate cross-section. To our knowledge, the appearance of this polymorph has not been described in the literature. We compared the present 2D classes to several other 2D classes of various amyloid fibril structures in the literature and could not find a correspondence. We are currently working on obtaining a 3D reconstruction. Multiple distinct polymorphs may be present.
Fitzpatrick, A. W. P., Falcon, B., He, S., Murzin, A. G., Murshudov, G., Garringer, H. J., Crowther, R. A., Ghetti, B., Goedert, M., & Scheres, S. H. W. (2017). Cryo-EM structures of tau filaments from Alzheimer’s disease. Nature, 547(7662), 185–190. https://doi.org/10.1038/nature23002
Yang, Y., Arseni, D., Zhang, W., Huang, M., Lövestam, S., Schweighauser, M., Kotecha, A., Murzin, A. G., Peak-Chew, S. Y., Macdonald, J., Lavenir, I., Garringer, H. J., Gelpi, E., Newell, K. L., Kovacs, G. G., Vidal, R., Ghetti, B., Ryskeldi-Falcon, B., Scheres, S. H. W., & Goedert, M. (2022). Cryo-EM structures of amyloid- 42 filaments from human brains. Science, 375(6577), 167–172. https://doi.org/10.1126/science.abm7285
